summary: This is a supplemental declaration filed by a BOP staff attorney in a FOIA lawsuit brought by The New York Times against the Federal Bureau of Prisons. The declaration corrects a prior statement about a log book, clarifying it recorded a phone call made by Jeffrey Epstein on July 30, 2020, not a visit he received.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The deceased inmate at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) whose activity log (a phone call) is the subject of the FOIA request and this correction.

events.title: Epstein's recorded phone call at MCC
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein made a phone call from the Metropolitan Correctional Center, which was logged in the Intake Screening Phone Log in the Receiving & Discharging area.

events.title: Original declaration filed in FOIA case
events.description: A declaration was submitted by the BOP staff attorney in the FOIA case, which contained an error describing the July 30 log as showing a visitor instead of a phone call.

events.title: Supplemental declaration filed to correct error
events.description: This supplemental declaration was executed to correct the mischaracterization of the July 30, 2020 log entry from a visit to a phone call made by Epstein.

locations: United States District Court Southern District of New York
keyFacts: The document corrects a prior official declaration, stating a log book showed a phone call made by Jeffrey Epstein on July 30, 2020, not a visit he received.
The log in question is an Intake Screening Phone Log kept in the Receiving & Discharging area of the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC).
This filing is part of a FOIA lawsuit (20-cv-00833) brought by The New York Times Company against the Federal Bureau of Prisons.
The correction is submitted in support of the BOP's motion for summary judgment in the FOIA case.
